content: Amy Ogan | Human-Computer Interaction Institute Skip to main content Search Expand Menu Close Menu Amy Ogan Associate Professor of Learning Sciences Faculty PhD Alumni BHCI Alumni Class of 2003 Email aeo@cs.cmu.edu Campus Address Newell-Simon Hall 3527 Links Website Google Scholar Program Website: Learning Sciences for Innovators Research Areas Learning Sciences and Educational Technologies Human-Centered AI Games and Play Interaction and Experience Design Advisees Christine Kwon Phenyo Moletsane Administrative Staff Reenie Kirby I am an educational technologist focusing on ways to make learning experiences more engaging, effective, and enjoyable. My training spans many disciplines, with undergraduate degrees in Computer Science and Spanish, and a Ph.D. in Human-Computer Interaction supported by a fellowship from the Institute of Education Sciences (IES). I have been named a Rising Star in EECS by MIT, a World Economic Forum Young Scientist, received the McCandless Chair and the Thomas and Lydia Moran Professorship in Learning Science, and been awarded the Jacobs Early Career Fellowship to study the use of educational technologies in emerging economies. I have been a visiting researcher at USC’s Institute for Creative Technologies and the Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile, and have conducted field research on the deployment of educational technology across many international sites. My research (CV) is supported by the National Science Foundation, Google, the McDonnell Foundation, and the Jacobs Foundation.
